document_data.name: Akyid al-Neti
document_data.titles: Headmaster, Dean of the College of Magic
document_data.mainbody: '''Akyid al-Neti''' was the Headmaster of [[Al-Bidir Sallah]], or the "Home of the Seekers of Knowledge", which was located in [[Huzuz]], in [[1367 DR]].{{AQ-time}}
document_data.Activities:
Akyid lectured for several hours each week covering the finer points of magic. His audience for these lectures was composed of wizards of at least moderate skill.

[[Ajami|Foreign wizards]] wishing to study at the College of Magic were first interviewed by Akyid to determine their motives. These interviews were conducted while Akyid wore a ''[[ring of truth]]'' so he could discern if the applicants were lying to him.
document_data.History:
Akyid was also the dean of the College of Magic and the third such person to hold the title of Dean and Headmaster at the University.

He believed that anyone possessing a modicum on intelligence could learn at the least basic magical skills.
